values: Title: A Bitter Bargain Characters/Pairings: Ron, Snape, Ron/Harry Ratings: PG-13 Summary: Ron Weasley has to make a deal with the devil to save his friend's life. Author's Notes: Many thanks to the lovely and the incomparable for all their help. Any remaining errors belong to me. A Bitter Bargain

Title: Five Days in August Team: Het Prompt: Summer Rating: R Pairing: Ron/Pansy Warnings: Fic might result in silly grins and the occasional chortle. Or, perhaps, make you want to slap me. It's all good. Length: 6,268 words Summary: Ron tries to find a way to escape the excessive heat and Pansy Parkinson. Not necessarily in that order.

Title: Skin Deep Pairing: Snape/Tonks Rating: possibly NC-17 Summary: She needs something. He needs something. It was to be a simple trade. Author's notes: Many thanks to -- the wind beneath my wings. Any remaining mistakes belong to me. Skin Deep

Title: New Beginnings and Old Tree Houses Pairing: Ron/Remus Rating: Very nearly but not quite R. Perhaps a hardish PG-13. Summary: Three small children are the only survivors of a horrible attack on a school. Ron Weasely decides that someone needs to look after them. He also decides that that someone needs the sort of help that only Remus Lupin can provide. Notes: Many thanks to the lovely . Any remaining mistakes belong to me. New Beginnings and Old Tree Houses

Title: Midnight in the Owlery Pairing: RL/SS Rating: PG-13 Summary: On a sleepless night Remus Lupin finds himself alone in the Hogwarts Owlery. He scribbles a note on a spare bit of parchment and sends it out into the dark night. What happens when someone answers? Author's notes: Written for the lovely and talented on the occasion of her birthday. Posted in . Many thanks to for doing battle with my grammar and for making Lupin less grabby. Any remaining errors-- and knowing me there will be a few -- belong to me. Midnight in the Owlery

Title: In the Quiet Time Pairing: Neville/Harry Rating: PG-13 Author's Notes: Written for the Late Bloomers 2 ficathon. For who requested Neville play up to his strengths, and be in a relationship of equals. Many thanks to for all her help. Any remaining errors belong to me. Summary: "I think we are all who we are supposed to be, be it a war hero or a herbologist. We all have our place and our purpose. It doesn't matter that Voldemort chose you or not; you are Harry Potter and you would always be Harry Potter. In the Quiet Time

Title: Implausible, Irrational, Preposterous, Peculiar, and Just Plain Luna Pairing: Severus / Luna Rating: PG-13 Summary: Everyone needs rescuing at some point. What happens when your knight in shining armor is Luna Lovegood? Author's notes: A while back I asked if anyone wished a certain author would write a certain fic and someone requested something from me. Written for who wanted me to write a post-Hogwarts Snape/Luna. I've had the idea in my head since you made the request and I finally finished it. Hope you like it. Many thanks to for her help. All remaining errors belong to me. Implausible, Irrational, Preposterous, Peculiar, and Just Plain Luna

Title: The Odd Couple Pairing: RW/DM Rating: R Summary: Can two wizards share an apartment without driving each other crazy? Author's note: Dedicated to- I wanted to post this in time for your birthday but the gods were against me so Happy Friday. Many thanks to for her friendship all her help. Any remaining errors belong to me. Part One Part Two

Title: Tidings of Little Comfort and Questionable Joy Rating: PG-13 Recipient: Request: Something light-hearted about Remus and Severus having to share their first Christmas together with Harry, or Draco, or "Harry and Draco", or "Harry/Draco" - any rating from G to NC-17, any time and place, uncomfortable/funny moments between the characters would be great :) Summary: Will Harry and Severus put their difference aside long enough to grant Remus his Christmas wish? Yes and no. Author's notes: Thanks to several members of my flist for giving me inspiration when I needed it most. Look closely and some of you might see something familiar. Many thanks and for making me look good

Title: Requiem

Topic: Challenge prompt: Molly gives up on Percy and has to face what this means for her as a parent.
Rating: PG
Character or pairing: Molly Weasley
Rough word count: 2350
Notes: Many thanks to the lovely . All remaining errors are my own.

Title: Dense Takes a Holiday Rating: NC-17 lite Pairing: Percy/Tonks Challenge -- Percy/Tonks, white collar espionage for Summary: Take one uptight workaholic. Add one colorful Auror. Place on an island. Stir vigorously. Notes: Many thanks to the wonderful for all her help. It's her fault the fic is over the word limit. Dense Takes a Holiday

Title:Fantasy and Nonsense Pairing: Ron/Luna Rating: PG-13 Summary: Ron is having visions of Luna Lovegood, watching as the world disintegrates around her. He sets out to find her and save her before these images become reality. Author's note: Written for for the following prompt: After a run in with the brains in his fifth year, Ron finds he has disturbing visions. Something horrible is about to happen to Luna and he has to save her before it's too late. Many thanks to the lovely for her beta help and her patience. All remaining errors belong to me. Fantasy and Nonsense

Title: Daybreak Pairing: SS/RL Rating: PG-13 Summary: Two men sit on a hillside and watch the sunrise. Notes: Written for hp_literotica. Quotation Roulette: Sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.--Lewis Carroll (1832 - 1898), Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There This is also a belated birthday present for the fabulous . Many thanks to for her beta help and encouragement--I'm sorry I made you read Snupin. Daybreak

Title: Echoes in the Darkness Rating: PG-13 Pairing: SS/RL, SS/SB, SB/RL, SS/RL/SB Summary: Remus Lupin has disappeared. Sirius Black and Severus Snape put their differences aside to find him. Are they prepared for what else they might find? Notes: Many thanks to abagail89 and leftsockarchive for all their help with this fic. Echoes in the Darkness

Title: Tuesday Pairing: RW/HG Rating: NC-17 Summary: Ron has finally figured out how to get through his classes. Author's Notes: Written for the lovely . Many thanks to for her beta help. Posted at and . Tuesday

Title: Choices Pairing: SS/RL Rating: PG-13 Summary: Sirius Black makes a startling discovery and now he has a choice to make. Notes:Written prior to OotP so Sirius is alive and well. A thank you to bluemeanie who helped me through this. Special thanks to Angelfeather for her insight and patience. Choices

Title: Rain

Pairing: RW/HG, HP/GW, Others

Rating: PG-13

Summary:

A world of Weasleys to choose from, and all of them diverse.

Why choose just one when I could have the lot, and say it all in verse.

Notes:

A word of thanks to Sad Diamonds, a poet and a friend,

Whose insight made my little poem better in the end.

I called upon Angelfeather, beta extraordinaire,

Because my poem [and my grammar] needed some repair.

Rain

Title: A Single Piece of Mistletoe

Pairings: RW/HG, HP/GW, NL/LL

Rating: PG-13

Summary: From the archway leading to the Great Hall hangs a single piece of mistletoe. A story about the magic in traditions and the power of a kiss.

Notes: A very special thank you to Seakays and Diana for being outstanding betas.

A Single Piece of Mistletoe

Title:  The Nine Lives of Severus Snape

Pairing: SS/RL

Rating: PG-13

Summary: Severus goes exploring in his new Animagus form and finds more than he bargained for.

Notes: The Severus Snape Fuh-Q Fest Three Word Challenge - Patronus, slug, bubotuber. (www.snapeff.ebonyx.org) Thanks to Kari for her help. Special thanks to Isis for making this fic legible. And thanks to leftsockarchive for all her help. Any mistakes you find are mine.

The Nine Lives of Severus Snape

Translated - Russian -- here. Chinese -- here. (Very slow to upload.) Spanish -- here.

Title: Could Rating: Pg-13/ almost R Pairing: DM/RW Summary: Draco takes a moment to remember before he must forget. Notes: A thank you to who looked at this many moons ago. A very special thanks to -- you are my sunshine. Could

Title: What I Did On My Holiday, or How I Learned to Love Draco Malfoy Despite Knowing Better Pairing: RW/DM Rating: NC-17 Summary: Ron Weasley is forced to take an extended holiday from work and finds himself with an unexpected houseguest. Author's Notes: A bit of snarky banter, a bit of fluff, a bit of smut - fun for the whole family. Many thanks to for her beta help and wonderful suggestions. What I Did On My Holiday, or How I Learned to Love Draco Malfoy Despite Knowing Better

Title: Waiting, Wondering, and Wasting Time Pairing: HG/RW/HP Rating: NC-17 Summary: Suddenly she found herself feeling an excitement she had never previously felt and, with a smirk on her lips worthy of any Slytherin, thought, Well, why the hell not? Author's notes: Written for the incomparable . Many thanks to the lovely for all her help. Waiting, Wondering, and Wasting Time
Title: Lesser Languages Pairing: MM/SS (Gen) Rating: PG-13 Summary: Some need more than words to tell their story. Author's Notes: Many thanks to for her help. Lesser Languages German Translation

Title: Claiming Hearts Rating: NC-17 Pairing: Remus Lupin / Hannah Abbott (yes, really) Summary: Hannah Abbot finds herself alone in the world and unable to do magic. Can Remus Lupin help her learn to live again? Notes: Special thanks to Portkey and Sad Diamonds for their help. Claiming Hearts

Title: Negotiations Pairing: SS/HP Rating: PG-13 Summary: Severus Snape is the new headmaster of Hogwarts and his first duty is not to kill the new deputy headmaster. Author's Notes: Many thanks to for all her help. Negotiations

Title: Enigmas, Conundrums, and Other Mysteries Pairing: SS/RL Rating: PG-13 Summary: Despite a history that spanned decades, Remus Lupin found he didn't know much about the elusive Potions master. Author's Notes: I had started a birthday fic for , but it sucked so spectacularly that I had to put it out of its misery -- it was the only humane thing to do. Since I missed her birthday, I opted for Christmas. Many thanks to for her invaluable help. Enigmas, Conundrums, and Other Mysteries

Title: Sojourn Pairing: SS/RL Rating: PG-13 Summary: A tattered black veil stands before them. Remus Lupin needs to travel to the other side to save his past, but the journey comes at a price. It is a price that Severus Snape must be willing to pay. Author's Notes: Special thanks to for her wonderful suggestions and encouragement. Sojourn

Title: A Faded Melody Pairing: RL/NT Rating: PG-13 Summary: "And that blasted song played on--louder and louder, until it drowned out everything else. Louder and louder, until he feared he would go deaf. Until he was sure it was all he would ever hear again." Remus is haunted by a melody and the ghosts it brings with it Author's notes: This was written as a birthday present for . Many thanks to for her help. A Faded Melody Translated in Italian - here

Title: This Side or The Other Rating: PG-13 Pairings: None Summary: Saying goodbye is never easy, no matter on which side you find yourself. Warnings: Character Death Author's note: Not nearly as morbid as it sounds. I promise. Written for The Albus Dumbledore ficathon for who asks "Why he is alone in the books?" I thought about this for a long time, and this is the result. Many thanks to for her help. This Side or The Other

Title: Your Friends and Neighbors Pairing: R/H/Hr Rating: R Summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione move into their new home. Someone is watching them very closely. Author's note: Written for the triofqf challenge: Neighbours find out about The Trio and make life difficult for them. Many, many thanks to and for all their help and spot-on suggestions. Title taken from a 1998 Neil LaBute film. Your Friends and Neighbors

Title: Your True Face Pairing: Lupin/Tonks Rating: NC-17 Summary: Remus Lupin is dying before your eyes and you need to make it better. You were never very good with words, but there is one thing you can do. Notes: Many thanks to for her invaluable help.
